title: Bug 12906 - Unable to open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should provide error message)
description: Bug 12906 - When a file is already opened in one editor, it cannot be opened in another editor in the Java Perspective. A warning or error message should be displayed to inform the user that they may overwrite changes.
OB:
1. Close all open editors. 
2. In the Java Perspective, double-click on a Java file to open it in the workbench. 
3. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. 

Expected Behaviour: A warning message should be displayed, informing the user that opening the file in the system editor may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, prompting the user to close all open files first.
SR:
To reproduce the bug: 
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files. 
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. 

Results: Nothing happens. There is no warning or error message displayed.
